feed.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [RBX2A][Managed vSphere] - Storage maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 11, 07:30 - 22:00 UTC

Oct 23, 16:43 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed vSphere offer in RBX2A region.

Start time : 11/12/2025 07:30 UTC
End time : 11/12/2025 22:00 UTC
Service impact : There will be no impact on the vSphere UI, data availability, or virtual machines during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling out an update for multiple storage servers.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [RBX2][Hosted Private Cloud] - Racks 31A16/31A17/31A18 maintenance notification
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Nov 24, 21:00 UTC  -  Nov 25, 06:00 UTC

Nov 4, 21:44 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, we will be carrying out a maintenance on hosts located in racks 31A16, 31A17 and 31A18.

Start time : 24/11/2025 21:00 UTC
End time : 25/11/2025 06:00 UTC
Service impact : Hosts in the specified racks will be temporarily unavailable up to 9 hours during the maintenance.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be moving hosts in the specified racks from RBX2 to RBX7.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [RBX8][Hosted Private Cloud] - Host incident notification
entry.content:
Nov 14, 16:02 UTC
Resolved - We are pleased to inform you that the incident affecting our Hosted Private Cloud offer has been resolved.

Start time : 14/11/2025 15:25 UTC
End time : 14/11/2025 15:55 UTC
Root Cause : This incident was caused by a cooling system issue.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 14, 15:42 UTC
Identified - We are currently experiencing an ongoing incident. We have determined the origin of the issue affecting our Hosted Private Cloud offer offer on the specific racks R808R19.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 14/11/2025 15:25 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Some hosts are unavailable in the racks R808R19.
Customers Impact : Customers are temporarily unable to access and use their services located in the specific rack.
Root Cause : This incident was caused by a cooling system issue.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

Nov 14, 15:39 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an ongoing incident. We have determined the origin of the issue affecting our Hosted Private Cloud offer.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 14/11/2025 15:25 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Some hosts are unavailable in the racks R808R19.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

entry.title: [EU/CA][Managed vSphere] - vSphere maintenance notification
entry.content:
Nov 13, 19:58 UTC
Completed - We would like to inform you that the maintenance on our is now completed.
All services are operational.
Thank you for your patience throughout this maintenance.

Nov 12, 08:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Nov 4, 21:12 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Managed vSphere offer.

Start time : 12/11/2025 08:00 UTC
End time : 13/11/2025 17:00 UTC
Service impact : vSphere will not be accessible and the hosts will be put into maintenance mode during the operation.
If the host has virtual machines in it, a vMotion will be performed.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will be doing a maintenance on our Managed vSphere offer.
An individual communication will be done to inform customers.
Customers can reschedule the operation through the manager.

Thank you for your understanding

entry.title: [RBX8][VMware Private Cloud] - Racks R807L16 - R807L17 - R807L18 incident notification
entry.content:
Nov 13, 16:45 UTC
Resolved - We are pleased to inform you that the incident affecting our VMware Private Cloud offer has been resolved.

Start time : 12/11/2025 10:56 UTC
End time : 13/11/2025 16:40 UTC
Root Cause : A service disruption occured due to an unexpected infrastructure malfunction.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 13, 11:01 UTC
Update - Service has been fully restored since 12/11/2025 17:29 UTC. Monitoring remains active to ensure long-term stability.

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : All services are operating at nominal capacity on Cluster9520 / Cluster9521 / Cluster9522 / Cluster9608 / Cluster9711.
Ongoing Actions : Actions are still ongoing on Cluster9601 and Cluster9602, but they do not impact service availability.

Our teams are still working on the incident to definitely fix the incident.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 12, 17:40 UTC
Monitoring - Service has been fully restored since 12/11/2025 17:29 UTC. Monitoring remains active to ensure long-term stability.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 12/11/2025 10:56 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : The following clusters were temporarily impacted:
- Cluster9520
- Cluster9521
- Cluster9522
- Cluster9601
- Cluster9602
- Cluster9608
- Cluster9711

Our teams are still working on the incident to definitely fix the incident.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 12, 16:41 UTC
Update - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : Cluster9520, Cluster9521 and Cluster9522 are no longer impacted.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are currently working on the remaining impacted cluster which is: Cluster9608

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 12, 16:24 UTC
Update - We have new information regarding the incident that affected your service(s).

Please find below an update on the situation:
Update : Cluster9601 and Cluster9602 are no longer impacted.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are currently working on the remaining impacted clusters which are:
- Cluster9520
- Cluster9521
- Cluster9522
- Cluster9608

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 12, 14:52 UTC

- Cluster9520
- Cluster9521
- Cluster9522
- Cluster9601
- Cluster9602
- Cluster9608

Nov 12, 12:40 UTC

Nov 12, 11:50 UTC
Identified - We are currently experiencing an ongoing incident. We have determined the origin of the issue affecting our VMware Private Cloud offer on the specific R807L16, R807L17, R807L18 region.

Here are some supplementary details :

Start time : 12/11/2025 10:56 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : We are currently facing an issue with cluster9520, cluster9521, cluster9522, cluster9601, cluster9602, cluster9608, cluster9711, which are temporarily inaccessible. The datastores hosted on this cluster are also unavailable.

Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

Nov 12, 11:22 UTC

entry.title: [ERI][Managed vSphere] - Multiple racks incident notification
entry.content:
Nov 13, 10:06 UTC
Resolved - We are pleased to inform you that the incident affecting our Managed vSphere offer in ERI has been resolved.

Start time : 13/11/2025 01:46 UTC
End time : 13/11/2025 09:45 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Most of datastores in ERI were temporarily unavailable
Customers Impact : Customers were experiencing malfunctions when they wanted to access their storage in this DC.
Root Cause : This incident was caused by an electrical equipment issue.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 13, 09:48 UTC
Update - The incident is still ongoing. We would like to assure you that we are doing our utmost to resolve this situation as quickly as possible.

Update : Most of services are operational again.

As soon as the situation evolves or the incident is resolved, we will keep you informed.

Thank you for your understanding

Nov 13, 07:05 UTC
Update - The incident is still ongoing. We would like to assure you that we are doing our utmost to resolve this situation as quickly as possible.

As soon as the situation evolves or the incident is resolved, we will keep you informed.

Thank you for your understanding

Nov 13, 02:52 UTC
Update - Please find below an update on the situation:
Customers Impact : Customers are temporarily unable to access and use their VMs located in the specific rack.
Ongoing Actions : Our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 13, 02:37 UTC
Identified - We have determined the origin of the incident affecting our Managed vSphere offer in the rack ERI0111C03B.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 13/11/2025 01:46 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Some datastores in rack ERI0111C03B are temporarily unavailable.
Customers Impact : Customers are experiencing malfunctions when they want to access their storage in the specific rack.
Root Cause : This incident is caused by an electrical equipment issue.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.
